titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Krystyna Sanderson Photographs
1980-2004
PR 445
titlestmt.author: Larry Weimer and Margo Padilla

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-05-25 10:02:27 -0400.

did.physloc: Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.
did.langmaterial: The documents in the collection are principally photographic; any text is in English.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be stored offsite. For more information on making arrangements to consult them, please visit www.nyhistory.org/library/visit.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p:
Taking images of documents from the library collections for reference purposes by using hand-held cameras and in accordance with the library's photography guidelines is encouraged. As an alternative, patrons may request up to 20 images per day from staff.
Application to use images from this collection for publication should be made in writing to: Department of Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024-5194, rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 282.
Copyrights and other proprietary rights may subsist in individuals and entities other than the New-York Historical Society, in which case the patron is responsible for securing permission from those parties. For fuller information about rights and reproductions from N-YHS visit: https://www.nyhistory.org/about/rights-reproductions

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
The collection should be cited as: [Name], MS/PR #, [if applicable: Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections], New-York Historical Society.
For PPAC, add credit line if one specified in deed of gift

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: TBD

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A. An archival binder with:

An announcement of the exbition and the list of exhibited photographs, an article by Czeslaw Czaplinski, "Co to znaczy byc Polakiem w Amercye" ("What It Means to Be Polish in America"), Now Dziennik, December 5, 1985, flashdrive with selected digital photographs, etc.
10 archival sleeves containing 35mm color slides of:

1. Pulaski's Day Parade, 5th Avenue, Manhattan, October 1982.
2. Poznaski's Bakery, 668 Manhattan Avenue, Greenpoint, Brooklyn, 1982.
3. Kurowycky's Butcher, 124 First Avenue, East Village, November 1982.
4. East Village, Manhattan, 1982-1983.
5. Greenpoint, Brooklyn, 1982-1985.
6. The Kosciuszko Foundation Annual Dinner Ball, Manhattan, Feburary 1983.
7. St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyr's Church, 101 E 7th St, East Village, 1983.
8. Polish Heritage Festival, Holmdel, NJ, 1983.
9. St. Stanislaus Kostka Church, Greenpoint, Brooklyn, December 1983.
10. Polish Wedding at St. Stanislaus Kostka Church, Greenpoint, Brooklyn, June 1984.
29 archival sleeves with 35mm negatives and proofs of Polish-Americans in Greenpoint and the East Village, 1980-1984:

1. East Village, Manhattan, October 1980.
2. St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyr's Church, East Village, Manhattan, October 1930.
3. Christmas Eve, Greenpoint, Brooklyn, December 1980.
4. Same as above.
5. Same as above.
6. New Year's Eve, St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyr's Church School, East Village, Manhattan, 1980.
7. Christmas Pageant, St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyr's Church School, East Village, Manhattan, 1981.
8. Same as above.
9. Same as above.
10. Good Friday, St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyr's Church, East Village, Manhattan, April 1981.
11. Holy Saturday, Blessing of the Food, St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyr's Church, East Village, Manhattan, April 1981.
12. St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyrr's Church, East Village, Manhattan, June 1981. 13. Same as above.
14. St. Stanislaus Kostka Church, Greenpoint, Brooklyn, June 1981.
15. Funeral, St. Stanisulaus Kostka Church, Greenpoint, Brooklyn, June 1981.
16. Same as above.
17 St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyr's Church, East Village, Manhattan, August 1981. 18. Miss Polonia Beauty Pageant, St. Stanislaus Kostka Church, Greenpoint, Brooklyn, September 1981.
19. Same as above.
20. St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyr's Church School, East Village, Manhattan, October 1981.
21. East Village, October 1981.
22. St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyr's Church School, East Village, Manhattan, October 1981.
23. Pulaski's Day Parade, 5th Avenue, Manhattan, October 1981.
24. Same as above.
25. St. Stanislaus Kostka Church School, Greenpoint, Manhattan, October 1981.
26. Same as above.
27. E 7th St, East Village, Manhattan, June 1982.
28 Wedding, St. Stanislaus Kostka Church, Greenpoint, Brooklyn, June 1984.
29. Same as above.
B. An archival binder with 14 original 11"x14" photographs of Polish-Americans in Greenpoint and the East Village, 1980-1984:

1. Pani Maria, E 7th St, East Village, June 1982.
2. Two Dancers, The Polish Ameircan Folk Dance Company, Inc., St. Stanislaus Bishop and Marytyr's Church, East Village, March 1981.
3. Woman I, E 7th St, East Village, October 1980.
4. Woman II, East Village, October 1981.
5. Altar Boys, St. Stanislaus Kostka Church, Greenpoint, Brooklyn, June 1981.
6. Good Friday, St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyr's Church, East Village, April 1981.
7. Krakowianka, St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyr's Church, East Village, March 1981.
8. Solidarity, 93 1/2 E 7th St, East Village, June 1982.
9. Krakowianki i GÃ³rale, St. Stanislaus Kostka Church, Greenpoint, Brooklyn, June 1983.
10. Lowiczanka, Pulaski Day's Parade, Fifth Avenue, New York City, October 1982.
11. Krakowianki, Polish Heritage Festival, Holmdel, NJ, 1983.
12. A Veteran, Polish Heritage Festival, Holmdel, NJ, 1983. 13. Monsignor Karpinski, St. Stanislaus Bishop and Martyr's Church, East Village, April 1981.
14. Monica, Greenpoint, Christmas Eve, 1983.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A. An archival binder with:
Assorted materials, CD with selected digital photographs and CD with the PowerPoint Places of Light with Music.
Archival sleeves with 35mm black and white negatives, proofs, and selected 8"x10" photographs of Places of Light, 1990. All photographs were done in New York City:

1. The National Arts Club, 15 Gramercy Park South, October 3, 1990 and the Cloisters, Fort Tryon Park, October 5, 1990.
2. The Cloisters, Fort Tryon Park, October 5, 1990.
3. Same as above.
4. The Abigail Adams Smith Musuem, 421 E 61st St, October 6, 1990. College of St. Vincent, 6301 Riverdale Avenue, Bronx, NY, October 7, 1990.
5. Friends Meeting House, 15 Rutherford Place, Grace Church, 802 Broadway, October 8, 1990.
6. The Cloisters, Fort Tryon Park, July 4, 1990.
7. Grace Church, 802 Broadway, October 8, 1990.
8. Thanasi Aronis' apartment, 95 Christopher St, July 3, 1990.
Additional 12 rolls of 35mm black and white negatives of New York City sites.

did.unittitle: Series III. Solitude: Light and Stillness (box 3)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A. An archival binder with:
Assorted materials, CD with selected digital photographs and CD and CD with PowerPoint presentation with music: Solitude: Light and Stillness.

Archival sleeves with 35mm and 120mm black and white negatives, proofs and selected 5"x7" and 8"x10" black and white photographs of Solitude: Light and Stillness were doine in New York City, except Mrs. S and Barbi, done in Marion, MA.

B. An archival portfolio with 20 original silver gelatin 5"x7" photographs Solitude: Light and Stillness, printed on Agfa Portriga Rapid chlorobromide paper printed by the artist in New York City in 1999:

1. Janet: Solitude #1-3, Grace Church Rectory, 802 Broadway, 1997.
2. Margaret: Solitude #4-5, Grace Church Rectory, 1997.
3. Libby: Solitude #6-8, The House of the Redeemer, 7 E 95th St, 1998.
4. Sarah: Solitude #9-11, Queens County Farm Museum, Floral Park, NY, 1998.
5. Mrs. S: Solitude, #12-13, Marion, MA, 1998.
6. Barbi: Solitude #14-15, Marion, MA, 1998.
7. Jen: Solitude #16 and #17, 350 Cabrini Blvd, New York City, 1999.
8. Julie: Solitude #18-20, New York City, 1999.
Additional 6 packets of 35mm black and white negatives of New York City sites.

did.unittitle: Series IV. Light at Ground Zero: St. Paul's Chapel after 9/11 (box 2 & 3)
